body: Hi @bgibWh did you check the FAQ here for GPU on windows? https://deeplabcut.github.io/DeepLabCut/docs/recipes/installTips.html#how-to-confirm-that-your-gpu-is-being-used-by-deeplabcut

Hi Mackenzie,

I've checked the FAQ page for GPU's, downloaded a new driver (497.29), updated CUDA (11.5) then reinstalled Deeplabcut using the anaconda command prompt. I've also used conda install cudnn -c conda-forge ​after activating the environment but am still having issues. In ipython when I start training, the Dedicated GPU memory usage increases which is correct but there is no activity from CUDA. Any advice or suggestions would be greatly appreciated as it seems like I've done everything correctly according to GitHub and the FAQ page and only started having these issues when I updated everything from DLC-GPU to your newest version. Thanks again for all the help and hopefully can get deeplabcut up and running again as it's helped me so much with my research.

Best,
Brendan

Hey @bgibWh - can you try creating a new env `DEEPLABCUT` vs upgrading within the old one? they are slightly different. Latest CUDA, Driver, TF should all be fine!

Hi Mackenzie,

So updating DLC allows me to use my GPU for all processes except training. I tried both deeplabcut.train_network(config_path) and train_network(config_path,shuffle=1,trainingsetindex=0,gputouse=None,max_snapshots_to_keep=5, displayiters=1000,saveiters=20000, maxiters=200000) all I get is that it starts training then nothing happens after even if I wait days there are no iterations. Sometimes I get the error message:
2022-01-20 09:47:44.909180: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_dnn.cc:366] Loaded cuDNN version 8201
2022-01-20 09:47:50.465254: W tensorflow/core/common_runtime/bfc_allocator.cc:275] Allocator (GPU_0_bfc) ran out of memory trying to allocate 2.22GiB with freed_by_count=0. The caller indicates that this is not a failure, but may mean that there could be performance gains if more memory were available.

The caller indicates that this is not a failure, but may mean that there could be performance gains if more memory were available.

A this point I just need to train the network in order to do data analysis. I would even be happy just using the CPU instead of the GPU so do you have any suggestions/ how do I just use my CPU since this problem is persisting?

Best,
Brendan

That error says that the GPU is running out of memory.
1. Close all apps other than what you need
2. Set batchsize in the dlcmodels/train/pose_cfg.yaml to 1
3. in your call to analyze videos. Set gputouse=0, allow_growth=True, and displayiters=10 (for faster feedback, when it works and that’s printing too many lines, ctrl-c to cancel, and change it back)

  1.  Close all apps other than what you need
  2.  Set batchsize in the dlcmodels/train/pose_cfg.yaml to 1
  3.  in your call to analyze videos. Set gputouse=0, allow_growth=True, and displayiters=10 (for faster feedback, when it works and that’s printing too many lines, ctrl-c to cancel, and change it back)

Yes, those are very large images. You need to increase `max_input_size`. See Box 2 in the [docs](https://deeplabcut.github.io/DeepLabCut/docs/standardDeepLabCut_UserGuide.html).
Or, even better if possible, crop and/or downscale your images. You will otherwise be pushing the limits of an 8gb GPU, be stuck with a batchsize of 1, and (as the DLC papers have shown), there is very little accuracy penalty if any with downsampled images.

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

I have created a project using the GUI. When I switch to Colab to train, there are no errors but it gets stuck on training. I run deeplabcut.train_network, it loads the config and overwrites max_iters/display_iters/save_iters, it says "Starting training..." and then nothing happens. The cell appears to be running, but nothing else shows up.

### Operating System

Windows 10 Home

### DeepLabCut version

2.2.0.6

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

Colab Pro GPU

### Steps To Reproduce

In Google Colab:

`!pip install deeplabcut
%reload_ext numpy
%reload_ext scipy
%reload_ext matplotlib
%reload_ext mpl_toolkits

!pip install --upgrade scikit-image
!pip3 install pickle5

import deeplabcut
import pickle5 as pickle

from google.colab import drive
drive.mount('/content/drive')

ProjectFolderName = 'TST-AS-2022-03-03'
VideoType = 'mp4'
videofile_path = ['/content/drive/My Drive/DLC/'+ProjectFolderName+'/videos/']
videofile_path
path_config_file = '/content/drive/My Drive/DLC/'+ProjectFolderName+'/config.yaml'
path_config_file

shuffle = 1
deeplabcut.create_training_dataset(path_config_file, net_type='resnet_50', Shuffles=[shuffle], augmenter_type='imgaug', windows2linux=True)

deeplabcut.train_network(path_config_file, shuffle=shuffle, displayiters=10,saveiters=50, maxiters=500000, allow_growth=True)`
